author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1705774444}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand‚Äîthe hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed‚Äîthe hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120530775', 'num_games_owned': 3399, 'num_reviews': 342, 'playtime_forever': 715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 715, 'last_played': 1706717908}
review:
I'd say... Good. This is a Tower Defense game with some RPG elements. The Graphics are pixel good. Nice music. The story is funny but with a little bit of deep. Not bad.

No bugs or crashes.

Overall, it's entertaining. It's not like your regular Tower Defense game, since you also have troops and you need to take offense and defense at the same time. The pixel art is enjoyable and the story is both silly and somewhat philosophical. It's long enough for the very modest price they ask for. The only complaint would be that it becomes a little too chaotic at times. Nevertheless, a good choice for a casual challenge and some laughs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11207, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1683711071}
review:
Oh My Gore! is a mediocre gore/horror themed 2D retro pixel tower defense game with an amazing gimmick... you play the "bad guys".  Yeah, it's been done to death.  This is a routine TD where you get pretty free tower placement and a few spells/abilities to dump on mobs as well so you don't get too bored between building towers.  There's dozens if not hundreds of TD's on Steam and this one doesn't stand out. 

From a technical perspective, the game doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

The artwork here is terrible, it's a blend of old retro pixel "art" used as a substitute for contemporary PC graphics, and some of the most amateurish MS-Paint style drawings I've ever hurt my eyes on.  It's unclear if this is due to lack of budget to arrange someone who can do graphics properly, or lack of talent, regardless, the overall visual quality of the game is extremely low as a result of these decisions.

While there are options to change the resolution for the game, all this does is scale up the simplistic 2D art assets used to make the game, which makes little or no difference to the graphics quality.  Without any other substantial graphics tweaks, it's not possible for gamers to improve the lacklustre 2D visuals.

The developers didn't design the game for modern gaming PCs, as such the display resolution caps out at 1080p, a very low resolution that became mainstream back in 2006 and became obsolete when 4K entered the mainstream in 2014.  The game simply won't look right on modern gaming displays due to this failure on the part of the developers.

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

Oh My Gore! didn't appeal much to the people who own a copy of the game, either.  It has achievements, and they show us a very clear picture that the game didn't really capture any interest from gamers.  The most commonly and easily attained achievement is for killing 100 elves, you can get that within 10 minutes of playing (with your eyes closed), but only around 11 percent of players bothered to get that far before uninstalling the game.  Hardly a success story, gamers just weren't all that interested in the game.

Reviewing SteamDB to check how popular this game was with players reveals a surprise... there's a very healthy spike in player counts for the game.  But this isn't consistent with the achievement stats, that show only 11 percent of players bothered playing the game for any reasonable amount of time.  How is it possible for this game to have so many concurrent players who weren't even playing the game?  Trading cards.  Players will use card idling software to collect the cards and sell them, but this won't trigger any achievements in-game.  That tells us people only really bought this game for trading cards, and that's a damning indictment of the woeful quality.  A closer look at the numbers shows the game just has a couple of players every week running up the game and idling it for cards, then deleting it.  We must ask how it benefits gamers for there to be so many games like this, with no merit as a serious game, that only generate sales from people idling and selling the trading cards.

Oh My Gore! is relatively cheap at $2 USD, but it's not worth it. Given the defects and quality issues with the game, coupled with the unrealistic price, this is impossible to recommend.

review: This game seemed fun at first. Then it got really difficult really quick. Once the Orcs start coming, they ravish everything. You spend most your time trying to rebuild, and don't have time to pay attention to much else. Even on easy, the Orcs are a total pain.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140740401', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1249, 'last_played': 1676038568}
review:
Damn, that game was AMAZING!
Writing this after getting all achievements. It was pretty hard since there are practically no tutorials and guides here, but that made it much more fun! 
Also the soundtrack is incredible, the last stage was so epic with its own sad song.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083205708', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1650846793}
review:
Quirky characters, solid soundtrack, decent story. It's a great spin on traditional tower defence in that on certain levels you will be the attacker and need to decide at times which path to take. It can be difficult but never in a cheap way, I spent 14 hours playing this game and out of the 20 levels I only remember getting overly frustrated on one. 

I would definitely recommend this title and for the price you can't go wrong.

author: {'steamid': '76561198982089967', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1690371307}
review:
Ich bin verliebt !!!
Auch mich plagt das schlechte Gewissen das Spiel im Sale gekauft zu haben. Es ist definitiv mehr wert.
Die deutsche Syncro allein hat mich bereits im Tutorial mehrfach zum schmunzeln gebracht. absolut charmant und ich freue mich jetzt richtig ins Spiel einzusteigen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198969428448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1669055777}
review: Oh my gore! es uno de esos juegos que probablemente nunca escuches hablar y que pasaran, desgraciadamente, desapercibidos toda su existencia. El juego es un Tower Defense bueno, con un pixel art muy bonito y cierto nivel de violencia y gore como su propio nombre indica. Su historia est√° bien y sus personajes son carism√°ticos. Lo mejor de todo es que este juego lo compre por 40 c√©ntimos, me ha durado unas ocho horas y me ha entretenido y me ha hecho disfrutar m√°s que muchos juegos triple A que cuestan 50,60,70 o 80 euros. As√≠ que tanto como si lo encuentras de oferta (40 c√©ntimos) como si no (2 euros) te recomiendo encarecidamente este juego.

review:
Juego de defensa con torres, y que por alg√∫n motivo es super barato seis pesos, con logros, una historia de la que pase ol√≠mpicamente, un sistema de mejora de habilidades, m√∫ltiples personajes con habilidades distintas entre ellos (Los personajes son los lideres no juegas con ellos pero si afectan las torres y habilidades que puedes usar) 
	Y cuchame, le meti 7 horas sin ir a por el 100% si estas pelado y tienes que quemar horas este es definitivamente una muy buena opci√≥n y si sabes ingl√©s o todav√≠a eres joven y te interesa la historia puede que aprendas con este juego ten√≠a mucha historia que salte, pero creo recordar que tambi√©n es bastante humor√≠stico, pero adelante, juega.

author: {'steamid': '76561199083307450', 'num_games_owned': 642, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1662298013}
review:
Okay so... I don't hate the game. I don't. It's a fun mix of flash style strat game and tower defense. It really really reminds of me some of the best Armor Games flash games. The issue is, sometimes it reminds me too much of a flash game. Around level 6 there's a giant leap in difficulty. I quit playing after level 7, not because I kept dying, but because I was in a neverending stalemate with the opp. The enemy would continue getting stronger, and I could place more and more upgraded towers, but my troops could only be upgraded within the skilltree, and there's a food limit, so you can only send out a certain amount of troops.

So, I end up in a situation where the incoming enemy troops cut through my troops like butter, and then, in turn, my turrets turn them into swiss. I can't move my defensive line of towers up because every time I do, there's an enemy that melts anything it's too close to. 

It's not a terrible throwback to old flash games, but it really, really plays like one.

If the dev seemed to be still supporting it, I'd give it a tentative thumbs up. Alas, the Editor mode has been Coming Soon for over 5 years, and it doesn't seem like the dev is very interested in this project at all anymore. Sucks, it could've been a cool little gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972398521', 'num_games_owned': 713, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1654551373}
review:
Short, cheap, fun, and worth the low price. The game advertises there is a level editor coming but the game appears to be abandoned at this point, but don't let that be a deal breaker. I had a lot of fun going through the campaign and don't regret the 0.49 I spent on it on sale, and would have even been okay with the full price 1.99.

I beat the game and everything it has to offer in my 9 hours of game play. It's a casual game and even the hard difficulty didn't prove much of a challenge through most of the game, but did have a challenging enough so that i was never bored. I failed a few of levels had to replay them a few times but they were all fun. It's a game I will happily revisit sometime in the future to play through again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095200163', 'num_games_owned': 1003, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1650771923}
review:
Every once in a while a game comes along that is immaculate. A game so outstanding, it's a shining beacon of hope to the video game community. A game with graphics that are so visually stunning you'd have thought God had appeared in front of you. That Salvador Dali, Vincent Van Gogh, and Bob Ross themselves would weep at it's perfection. A game with a story written so perfectly, it would make William Shakespeare and Edgar Allan Poe jealous. A game with a soundtrack so perpetually perfect that Beethoven, Mozart, Chopin, Gesualdo, and every classical composer ever would be proud they inspired such greatness.

Yeah...this game is none of that. In fact the complete opposite. A reverse tower defense game. Even for what it is, completely subpar. *thumbs down fart noise*

author: {'steamid': '76561198881171625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1650066103}
review:
+ Es un tower-defense donde ademas de construir torres, enviamos unidades para tomar puntos.
+ El apartado art√≠stico gore y desagradable cumple bien con su meta.
+ La historia no aporta mucho, pero tiene su encanto y gracia.... los √∫ltimos cap√≠tulos se ponen turbina.
+ Buen uso del GORE, no solo como un sistema de defensa otaku, sino de forma c√≥mica.
+ El precio ayuda a que valga la pena darle una oportunidad.
+ El apartado sonoro y musical funcionan.

 *No vale la pena, tiene problemas y puede no gustarte porque:
- Como tower defense esta muy limitado, no hay profundidad jugable. 
- Un desbalance brutal, ya que con solo minotauros y torres de g√°rgolas solucionas casi toda la campa√±a
- Los niveles no tienen mucha complejidad y los mismos se hacen sosos pronto, al menos sirve para distraerse.
- La dificultad tiene el mismo problema, solo hace el juego mas lento con sus ya spawns de enemigos infinitos y el aumento de vida de los mismos a medida que pasa el tiempo. Al menos el juego te recompensa actuar r√°pido.
- Tiene problemas de rendimiento  ademas de una IA muy baja.
- Se siente desechable, poca rejugabilidad , mucha repetici√≥n de situaciones y enemigos nada variados (solo sus stats y sprites).

author: {'steamid': '76561198048459412', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 825, 'last_played': 1512698059}
review:
Enjoyable Tower Defense game

Pros:

- Get to be the bad guys, with decent bad guy humor
- Interesting mix of units and enemies
- No real technical issues

Cons:

- Few achievements are extremely hard to get
- Kinda depressing story line by the end

Overall, worth a buy, especially for the price/ fun ratio

review:
What does this game's plot and a knife plunged into a wound have in common?

[spoiler]The Twist.[/spoiler]

I came for the sale, considered refunding because it felt too much like a flash game, then, I blew an entire night's sleep in exchange for the unique spin on traditional TD gameplay.

I give this game a very high score of 40 songs in it's OST out of how many minions Raelius has at the end of the game.

review:
Not a bad game.
Slightly reminiscent of Dungeon Lords game.
Cheerful and fun until one moment.
Pretty dumb ending.
There are still many bugs and balancing.
And a lot of things can be improved.
But it's still not bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024753734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 238, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1631549827}
review: Oh My Gore! is tower defense game where you have to rush and complete every level as fast as possible. The game tells you this on loading screen. What kind of c*ck bending design is this? I think these c*ck breath devs don't know jack sh*t about tower defense games. You play tower defense games slowly and strategically. There is no time to make a plan in any level. As soon as the level starts, the game starts sending enemies to your base. First few waves consist of enemies that are easy to kill. If you don't complete the objective and waste time then the game starts sending enemies that are harder to kill. So either you are going to be fast, or the game is going to f*ck you in the as*. The enemies ignore the dedicated pathways and attack your towers from different angles. Your troops, on the other hand, has to move on this dedicated pathway. The AI sucks huge as*. When one of your monsters kills an enemy or destroys a tower, it starts moving back and then starts moving forward again. This causes you to lose time. Some levels expect you to be a miracle multitasker. You have to defend yourself against 4 or 5 enemy towers that simultaneously spawn enemies and send them to your base. The UI looks like it is made with MS Paint. The soundtrack is generic. The characters and their interactions with each other is good. Dark humor aspect of the game is really good but it isn't enough to save this dogsh*t. I finished the game, but I wouldn't recommend this monkey d*ck to tower defense fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005519534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1630113443}
review:
It's a cute little game. I got it for $2, and I'd say yeah, it's worth about that. I finished the 20-mission campaign on Normal after 7 hours.
There are playtest issues, like with traps being almost useless and not being able to beat certain levels unless you knew their layout through the fog of war beforehand. But hey, it's $2.

review:

I wouldn't recommend purely due to the fact you'll only really be playing this for the 5 hours or so needed to complete all the achievements and not much more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025493884', 'num_games_owned': 536, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 12755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12755, 'last_played': 1626676764}
review: I absolutely loved this comical but dark slaughterfest! I can't recommend it enough. Tower defense assault matches with each hero providing different units to attack with while maintaining and building your towers. Fun selection of towers. Story is entertaining and funny at times. Full of twists. Only downside is the level editor has never been released... =( That plus workshop capability would have greatly enhanced playtime/come back potential.

review: It's a tower defense where you defend with towers AND attack by sending your own troops. You got a powerful hero defending your base, some spells, some traps, some upgrades, etc. Your towers are destroy-able by various enemies but the Minotaur are the only one who can relay destroy one, all the others aren't as beefy and powerful to do it.Overall: 8/10 Enjoyable if you like TD and can overlook the Graphics

I rate this crazy game for 10/10 THANK YOU Bumblebee!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018117897', 'num_games_owned': 2025, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1612821362}
review:
'Oh My Gore!' looks like it could've been a very interesting hidden gem. However, when playing it I quickly noticed its poor execution and horrible balance.

 * Enemy units constantly get stronger as time passes, forcing you to rush the enemy or else stand [b]no[/b] chance later. Because this issue will quickly lead to [i]literally[/i] undefeatable enemies.
 * A lot of units can walk huge distances off their given paths to attack their targets. This allows enemies to basically skip terrain entirely.
 * The AI and pathfinding are very bad. It's really frustrating watching your units backtrack back up the path every time they kill an enemy.
 * Traps are worthless. They expire very quickly, don't do anything to most enemies, and even affect your own units as well.
 * I believe the layout and allocated build space in a lot of maps could've been designed better.
 * The UI is really clunky and slow to respond, and the audio is often delayed. At least in my experience.
 * Oh My Gore's writing, dialogue and voice acting are really bad in my opinion. It often made me cringe.

These issues make it nearly impossible to enjoy this game, and they [i]need[/i] to be fixed. Not that I expect that to happen since the developers have seemingly abandoned this game. So all in all, this game more than deserves a negative review in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018851754', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1611421756}
review:
Ich kann mich den Meisten anschlie√üen, sehr nett gemacht, aber WC3 kommt dem hier aber √ºberhaupt nicht nahe, auch wenn es gewollt war.
Warcraft 1, 2 und 3, die Ressourcen zu sammeln und Basis aufbauen fehlt hier komplett, die Helden sind nicht levelbar und die Einheiten k√∂nnen nur die vorgegebenen Wege entlang gehen um Feindliche Kasernen und T√ºrme auszuschalten. Ich bin eher ein Fan der ersten beiden Teile, die Helden Klassen fand ich immer √ºbertrieben, so gingen die Magie Klassen im dritten Teil unter aber die Story, war bei WC 3 einfach episch.

Ein Negativ Kommentar bezieht sich darauf, dass man die Einheiten nicht beeinflussen kann welchen weg diese gehen, das stimmt aber √ºberhaupt nicht.
Eine andere Rezension bezieht sich auf die Synchronsprecher, √§√§hhhm wtf? Hast du eine andere Version gekauft? Die Originalsprache ist deutsch wie mir scheint, Synchronsprecher m√ºsste es wenn f√ºr eine Englische Sprachversion geben.

Die Mischung ist gut, ist halt nicht nur ein Tower-Defense Game und hat lustige Charaktere und so seine Momente. Das Rumgest√∂hne ist nervig, und es gibt glaube ich nur 2 Sprecher und eine Sprecherin die dem ganzen ihre Stimme geliehen haben.

Nettes RTS Game

author: {'steamid': '76561198122258825', 'num_games_owned': 3711, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 1146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1146, 'last_played': 1608573285}
review:
[list][*][b][h1]Morlan's shorts:[/h1][/b][/list]
A straightforward tower defence with a satirical gory twist. There are upgrades on the buildings while fighting, bonuses for your troops/buildings' stats after gathering blood to spend on, more characters which unlock while playing the story mode -each with their own special skill-, freedom of placement selection and the story has quite a few funny bits. Fun game with a very funny price.. So low, it's hilarious!

[b]Don't waste more time reading lengthy reviews.. time is of the essence![/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197976408337', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 346, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1609355216}
review:
[h1] Overall = 4/10 [/h1]

A relatively basic tower defence / real-time strategy hybrid game where you not only have to defend a base but also attack another by sending your own troops.  The division of focus means there‚Äôs always something to do, but the difficulty is very unbalanced and sometimes unfair as traps only last so long and hurt your own troops, towers can be destroyed very quickly and you can‚Äôt actually control your troops, only send more.  The troop pathfinding is poor with both sides constantly backtracking or wandering off the path.  Plus, as the enemy is constantly sending troops, it devolves into a war of attrition and on some maps, it becomes impossible to win after a while.

The story has an odd sense of humour about it, which did grow on me over time.  The writing is very quirky and is always trying to be funny and edgy but unfortunately rarely is.  The music doesn‚Äôt always fit with the setting and frequently drops out, and voice acting is random sound bites.  The pixel art graphics are ok ‚Äì there‚Äôs definitely a lot of gore and everything has some kind of animation, but it‚Äôs one of the uglier games I‚Äôve seen.

It‚Äôs cheap and an ok way to spend some time, but there are much better tower defence games out there.

review:
Typical tower defense game = Slowly add in units/tower abilities in such a way that provides difficulty and balancing with a chance to redo levels harder

Oh my gore = Completely casual
Normally i would say its great for 49 cents right now or even the full price of 2 dollars, for no other reason then the cheapness but the world is saturated with tower defense games. The tower defense games FREE on the internet (like older baloons and games on websites like newgrounds etc) and the tower defenses in custom games like starcraft and dota 2 are much better. So even at 49 cents its not worth installing a MEH tower defense game

review:
Oh My Gore!


Pros-

#1.Cheap

#2.Basic TD strategy game

#3.Some funny lines in the story



Cons-

#1.Graphics - I understand it is cheap so maybe unfair to bash graphics


#2.It is too basic of a TD game


The Bottom Line-


I will recommend this game but it is not for everyone.To me it is just too basic I wish they would of put more into the game even if they charged more for it.I read there is more towers and units if I continue but I dont care enough to do it.

You have to really love tower defense games to play this and I do but not enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014930293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 4373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4373, 'last_played': 1596925000}
review:
[h1] Great Concept, Shoddy Execution [/h1]

First, one thing I want to make clear. This game doesn't take 72 hours to beat, I simply left it on for long periods of time. Second, this is a negative review, so why did I even bother finishing the game? Because I have a compulsion to finish games once I start them unless they are literally unplayable. Don't be like me.

Now, onto the game. This is a hybrid where you build towers and send monsters out of your barracks to attack. The only control you have over the monsters is which direction/path they take when encountering intersections, I really like the idea for the game, but the developers did a poor job of implementing it.

The AI in this game is pretty wonky. You will experience moments where your units will destroy a tower or kill an enemy and then just turn around confused before eventually reorienting themselves and going the right way again. The units also stack on top of each other, so visually you often can't tell how many units are actually in one spot.

Managing towers quickly becomes unsatisfying as well. Many of your towers do not have a range greater than 2, with only one tower with a range of 4. This isn't terrible at first, but eventually you encounter enemies that prioritize targeting towers instead of units. These units are very strong and typically take down your towers in moments. Additionally, the places that you can and cannot place towers often make no sense and prevent you from using them to the fullest. You'll see positions where you want to place a tower, only to learn that this pile of bones or whatever the developer has chosen to add to the map blocks you, or that you can place towers in places where they can never actually hit enemies. There are traps that you can place on the ground, but they damage your units too so good luck using those effectively. Combined with the odd paths created, it just comes off as sloppy, like no one played through the game themselves to iron out these pain points.

Many of the units and towers are useless or at least inferior to others. I was curious if anyone else had this experience and saw that someone beat the game on Hard by using just one unit, the Minotaur. I was already using this unit primarily, but just to test it I did the same. So that's one unit that can likely carry you through the game. The towers are much the same, with the fire towers and gargoyle boulder throwers being the only useful ones you really need. 

The story is already nothing to write home about, and it is made worse by the mediocre English translation. There was one part where the text wasn't even in English for me, but German ([url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2191628713]Screenshot here[/url]). The story itself is confusing and the ending was very unsatisfying. It's sloppy, and again makes it seem as though no one played through the game.

You may be looking at this game and thinking "This looks interesting, and it's so cheap!" Don't bother. There are better tower defense games and better ways to spend your time and money. Move on and don't waste either.

review: This was sort of fun in the beginning, but I just couldn't stay in this game at all. At some point I dropped it entirely after getting some way through the campaign, and now it's just laying dormant in my library. It just get's difficult at some point, and there's not much to make me come back and keep going. Simplistic, but I guess that's what makes it underwhelming. I might recommend this, but only to people who have played games extremely similar to this and absolutely loved those games and wanted more, besides that, I don't recommend this at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028184614', 'num_games_owned': 1476, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 819, 'last_played': 1594270404}
review:
Great little hidden gem, well worth the price.

The good:
-Dirty cheap
-Tower defense+offense
-Can be done in a day (around 10h playtime total for achievements)
-Funny
-Good pixel art

The bad:
-Lots of bugs
-Lacks a few features like pausing to micromanage as you need to take care of both your attacking minions and towers on different lanes at the same time.
-Bad translation, also had a sudden German line (my game was full English) and a lot of typos, but you can ignore it and understand the whole story if you're not a grammar nazi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198800879051', 'num_games_owned': 3673, 'num_reviews': 373, 'playtime_forever': 723, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 720, 'last_played': 1593494800}
review:
Por donde empezar.
Tengo que admitir que el nombre, como no soy muy fan del "gore", no me llamaba para nada. Lo compr√© por las cromos nomas jeje.
Pero este juego me sorprendi√≥ en todos los sentidos, entr√© a probarlo, y termin√© jugando varias horas.
Por $7 pesos cuando est√° en oferta, que no te compras ni un chicle con eso, me encontr√© con un maravilloso juego. La historia es genial, un Tower Defense un poco distinto del resto creo, con un humor tonto pero agradable, musica entretenida y atrapante, buenos personajes, corto, muy simple pero divertido (Todo esto teniendo en mente que vale 7 pesos el juego, e incluso lo diria si costase m√°s).
En fin, super recomendado. Compralo si o si, no seas rata porque no sale nada, y disfrutalo. 

P/D: Hay m√°s que no dije, pero es para evitar spoilers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071522511', 'num_games_owned': 2705, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 976, 'last_played': 1591213563}
review:
This game is definitely worth the price for the amount of content and enjoyment you get out of it. 

I wasn't sure if I was gonna like the game or not going into it, but I was really pleasantly surprised with it. The pixel art is all really pretty, the characters are enjoyable, and the story keeps you interested until the end. It's pretty lighthearted with all the jokes and humor along the way despite how gory the game is and how dark the story is on paper. 

The gameplay is interesting with combining RTS and TD elements and most levels require you to utilize both. A decent amount of different heroes or in this case villains? to play as, all of which have a unique ability and units to go with them. 

There are a few grammar/spelling issues in the game and even one line of dialogue that wasn't translated at all, but overall the translation is surprisingly good with how many jokes and wordplay that's in the game.

review:
Weird balance, a bit of bad level design, and simplistic gameplay.

And yet this game is still good for 3 reasons:
1. Decent English translations.
2. A thoroughly intriguing plot.
3. It's actually pretty fun.

It's a nice little game that paces itself well, and doesn't overstay its welcome.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080692558', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1590498251}
review:
Positives:
-Der Humor ist gro√üartig und schwarz. Oft werden Cliches entweder knallhart und selbstironisch durchgezogen oder komplett unterwandert. Die Charaktere sind liebensw√ºrdig genug, um sich um sie zu k√ºmmern.
-Die Grafik ist charmant retro. Die Animationen laufen meist fl√ºssig und das Gore ist absolut √ºbertrieben dargestellt. Das Spiel h√§lt da, was es verspricht. 
-Die Story ist glaubw√ºrdig genug um akzeptiert zu werden. Der Plotverlauf ist organisch, die einzelnen Kapitel machen in dieser Reihenfolge Sinn.
-Variable Einheiten- und Turmauswahl, plus 6 Helden die deine Einheiten und Zauber etwas beeinflussen.
-Einige Level muss man mehr als einmal Spielen, bis man die Taktik herausgefunden hat.
-Der Soundtrack klingt gut und stimmig.

Negatives:
-Der Synchro merkt man das Indie an. Schneidet manchmal zu fr√ºh ab oder klingt vom Tonfall her etwas unpassend.
-Gelegentliche, l√§stige Bugs. Manche Felder lassen sich nicht klicken, manchmal ist ein Skript falsch gesetzt. Nichts, was das Spiel behinder w√ºrde, da letzteres nur in einer Szene im HUB passiert, aber dennoch.
-Wegfindungsst√∂rung der Einheiten. Mein mit Abstand gr√∂√üter Kritikpunkt. Gelegentlich verlassen Einheiten den angegebenen Pfad, um Gegner zu bek√§mpfen. Danach gehen sie zu einer unsichtbaren Wegmarkierung, die ziemlich weit weg sein kann, zur√ºck und wieder auf den Pfad. Das tun sie auch oft und gerne unter Beschuss.
-Kein Mikromanagement, wenig Makromanagement. Praktisch spammt man Einheiten und T√ºrme, unterbrochen von gelegentlichem Zaubern.

Mein Fazit ist, dass es die 2‚Ç¨ locker wert ist. Die Kampagne l√§sst sich in 5-7 Stunden locker runterspielen. Wer dann noch mehr will, kann sich noch die allesamt machbaren Auszeichnungen holen. Es steht zwar im Hauptmen√º, dass 'demn√§chst' ein Editor kommen wird, ich bezweifle aber, dass das Spiel noch Updates bekommen wird. Es lohnt aber dennoch, wo bekommt man sonst noch 5+ Stunden kreative Unterhaltung f√ºr 2‚Ç¨?

author: {'steamid': '76561198064626334', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1636148139}
review:
If you enjoy tower defense  and RTS games this game is definitely worth checking out.

As of writing this review I only have about 30 minutes of playtime and some notable features I really enjoy include:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-Epic music
-Plenty of blood and gore
-Art is colorful
-The enemies and special abilities are pretty cool

The game-play is pretty addictive and can definitely be challenging I could see myself losing hours trying to complete each level on every difficulty with three stars.

Complaints?
-I wish the game had a multiplayer feature.
- On the title screen there is a little editor tab that is grayed out with red text painted over that reads "coming soon!" which is disappointing considering I would have liked to play around with that feature.

The release date for this game was 2016 so I'm pretty sure the developer(s) have just abandoned this game and I will probably never see those features but all in all it's a pretty cool little game and I got it for like $0.50 USD on sale, I'd say it's worth a buy even at it's base price though.

tl;dr version:
This is a good game I recommend that you buy it and play it till your eyes become as red as the blood and gore in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090282586', 'num_games_owned': 294, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1587862471}
review:
Also nach 7 Stunden das Spiel auf einfachstem Niveau durchbekommen und muss sagen... mann hat mich das Spiel aufgeregt. Bei 3 Leveln h√§tt ich am Liebsten das Game geschmissen. Aber zu Erst eine Sache die mir extrem sauer aufgesto√üen hat. Immer wenn meine Leute einen Turm vernichtet haben, sind sie ein ganzes St√ºck zur√ºck gelaufen und dann wieder vor um den n√§chsten kaputt zu machen, dabei nat√ºrlich sch√∂n weiterhin Schaden durch die andren T√ºrme genommen. Keine Ahnung obs so gewollt is.. aber es is extrem √§rgerlich und MUSS ge√§ndert werden..

Einmal weil gegnerische Minotauren einfach die Wege ignorien, querfeld einlaufen, damit die Giftpf√ºtzen umgehen, dann s√§mtliche T√ºrme mit zwei Schl√§gen umhauen und dabei weiter au√üerhalb der Wege sin, die ich nicht mit Fallen bespicken kann..
Ein zweites Mal weil der Gegner 95% der Karte besitzt √ºberall verteilt Kasernen und T√ºrme hat und sehr oft T√ºrme die komplett nicht anzugreifen sind. Ich hab eine gigantische Masse an Kriegern gebraucht um da √ºberhaupt zum Boss zu kommen, der sich direkt in der Mitte einer riesigen Spirale aus einem einzigen Weg befand, wohin gegen ich gerade mal ein winziges Fleckchen Land hatte, ne einzelne Kaserne und keine einzige Baum√∂glichkeit. 4 Mal neu anfangen musste ich ehe ich eine gute Strategie hatte.
Und die 3. Situation wo man Spinnenlady und Knochenk√∂nig vernichten musste. Hier musste ich ebenfalls 4 Mal starten und hatte da gro√üe Probleme die Verteidigung zu Beginn hochzuziehen weil innerhalb 10 Sekunden bereits die ersten Biester kamen, die meine Kaserne auf 5% runtergepr√ºgelt hatten.. Was denen auch 2 Mal gelungen ist.

Sicherlich ist alles zu schaffen, aber f√ºr mich is DAS nicht 'einfach'. So wie hier hab ich mich echt selten aufgeregt. F√ºr die h√∂heren Schwierigkeitsgrade hab ich definitiv keine Lust, das Spiel is deinstalliert und GOTT SEI DANK hat es f√ºr mich nur 45 Cent gekostet. Da tut das nich weh. Die gute Wertung geb ich auch nur weil es zu 90% gut war. Lustig, sch√∂n das es in Schrift und Ton auf deutsch war und trotz Pixelgrafig echt sch√∂n gestaltet ist. Aber wiederspielwert hats f√ºr mich leider nicht, tut mir leid...

author: {'steamid': '76561198124275446', 'num_games_owned': 1852, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1585255761}
review:
Oh My Gore! seemed like a game tailor-made for me. I love tower defense, copious gore, and I far prefer being a villain than a hero, especially whenever you can be a necromancer. Oh My Gore! features all of this, but unfortunately, I found it fell far short of what I wanted in terms of tower defense.

Oh My Gore! has beautiful old school graphics, dark humor, and interesting locations and music. However, its problems begin with its lack of direction. Because the store page advertises it as tower defense and I'm well-versed in the genre, I started looking out for pathways and strategic places to set particular towers. It soon became clear that Oh My Gore! is a very weird mix of tower defense and tug-of-war strategy games. The tower defense part of the game is only half (one could argue even less) of the gameplay, and the game doesn't do a particularly good job of telling you what the goal is for each level. For example, one early level tasks you with razing a town, but it doesn't tell you how to do that before it starts sending waves of goodly warriors at you. Do you defeat so many waves of warriors? No. You have to send your own warriors down the same path, get to the town, and destroy particular buildings. You have no control over your warriors or even your hero.

The tower defense part of the game isn't very good at what it does, either. Sure, there are some interesting towers, but nothing we haven't seen in other games of the genre, and the large pathways make it difficult to place your towers in a worthwhile place. The game also gives you traps to play with, but because you're sending waves of your own soldiers down the same path, you risk harm to your own units. Also, traps deplete in health over time (poison pools get smaller, etc.). The towers can be upgraded in a generic fashion (improvements to damage, range, etc., but no upgrade pathways). The game doesn't alert you of this, nor does it tell you that goodly units can utterly destroy your towers until one is already gone. This becomes more of a problem in levels where there are multiple pathways and multiple barracks. Basically, you must fight the flow of enemies on multiple paths, utilizing towers and waves of your own units (who take from the same small resource pool). Making this more frustrating to do is the map navigation, where you must scroll for a while to check on multiple paths and waste precious seconds.

Oh My Gore! isn't a terrible game. It's just not great at tower defense, which is the element I looked forward to most. If you're someone who loves tower defense games with a twist (like Bardbarian, which I also didn't care for), you might like this. But I find that changing the genre to such an extreme degree makes it lose sight of its identity and the main reasons why I play TD games. Oh My Gore! is beautiful, particularly when enemies collapse in giblets and blood overwhelms a path. But try as I might, I failed to have any [i]fun.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198001328072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1583763055}
review:
[h1]Decent 'Tower Defense' type of game[/h1].
Got me entertained for about 7 hours (including finishing the campaign on 'Normal' difficulty and unlocking 70% of all achievements along the way.)

Comes wth some nice pixel art that got ruined by bad font choice, but oh well, at least some of the dialogs are funny and there is some story to unravel..

Additionally, there are some translation errors when playing in English.
Some dialog text still is written in German and some character speech / voiceover stays German as well.

The start menu promises an 'Editor Mode' but considering the release date of this game I don't think it's gonna happen. 

[h3]For  2 bucks still nice![h3]

author: {'steamid': '76561198341170003', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1656702623}
review:
O que dizer sobre 'Oh my Gore' que mal joguei e j√° considero pacas?

 Esse √© um t√≠tulo que envolve o estilo Tower Defense e alguns elementos  RTS. 
 Nele voc√™ assume o controle de Raelius, um antigo Deus da Guerra -muito carism√°tico- que √© pura encrenca e vai arranjar as maiores confus√µes contra humanos, elfos, minotauros, an√µes e v√°rios outros 'inimigos'. Veja tripas voando, soldados cortados ao meio, envie meteoros em elfas super do bem, invoque tornados em anjos e, principalmente, construa armadilhas de veneno quando minotauros aparecerem para derrubar suas torres -me agrade√ßa depois pela dica-.
 Se est√° em d√∫vida sobre comprar ou n√£o, se voc√™ gosta do g√™nero apenas compre. O game √© simples mas pelo pre√ßo, conquistas na steam e divers√£o proporcionada vale a pena. 
 Espere, pelo valor, um jogo humilde que vai chamar a aten√ß√£o pela simplicidade, doses de humor e por ser totalmente fora dos padr√µes comuns de jogos atuais. 
 
 A minha nota para o game fica em 7.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960773441', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1561525647}
review:
Decent tower defence game with some stages being some kind of reverse TD where you can't build anything and you send units along a path against their defence. Unfortunately, it's pretty short and a bit too easy even on the hardest difficulty. 

The only remotely challenging stages are those where your units need to reach an objective using the same path the enemy units are taking to kill your lord. The problem is that since their units scale with time and the player's units don't their units end up just slaughtering the player's when they meet up if you take too long. You then get in a stalemate where their units get destroyed by your towers but your units just get murdered trying to reach the objective because the enemy units spawn too fast and are too strong for yours to get through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067497444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1564231776}

author: {'steamid': '76561198137065965', 'num_games_owned': 601, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1560902884}
review: It started off fun, but the longer you play, the worse it gets. Pathing it bad; enemies (and allies) will cut through the paths for no reason, dodging everything, or forcing your mobs to fight them instead of going to where you want them. Wish the graphics were a little better too, despite it being an 8-bit 16-bit type of game, sometimes it's kind of hard to tell what you're looking at. Towers are super cookie cutter, without much useful description.

review: This strange TD game is something I don't really would part take again but it's not bad. It's basically a hot pocket it's good for a meal though not something you would really want given more choices. The writing is kinda wack as since there are no cutscenes, only text so some characters could refer to enemy/teammates and you wouldn't have a clue.Also since they are in medieval times they need to have these medieval names for the characters but they are so one dimensional that you make caveman names instead of remembering their actually name like Whiny Skeleton mc, Dark god, Red goblin,Spider lady,etc. The graphics I feel aren't too bad like a sega genesis game but not that great in retro feel + the game may feel a little repetitive/annoying as hell in later levels. In the end do I recommend it, sure why not it's $2 but it's only for TD fans, others wouldn't like it too much or complete it. Thank you for coming to my TED talk.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991689750', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1557832947}
review:
The graphics are nice old school looking pixel-style. The game mechanics are quite good. You both send out waves, defend with towers and you can have your towers destroyed. However, the game feels quite repetetive after a couple of hours and it is starting to feel like a grind.

I recommend it, but don't expect to have your mind blown.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019048903', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1700931018}
review:
The dialogue is hilarious, graphics aren't super elaborate but go along perfectly with the campy vibes. The game itself starts out easy but it picks up the pace at a steady rhythm and you'll soon find yourself carefully considering which leader's abilities are best for each mission and juggling cooldowns and resources to survive.

Absolutely worth its full price and more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039020670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1527475502}
review: There is A LOT of game here for $2.50 CAD. I'm five hours in and I'm not even halfway through the campaign. There's a neat gameplay element where you get a rhythm of defending then attacking, which I haven't encountered outside of this game before. It's not flawless, but if you've got a few bucks on your account, you could do much, much worse than spending it here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021800223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 476, 'playtime_forever': 1794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1751, 'last_played': 1537358174}
review:
For a such low price I didn't expect much. What I found is an interesting Tower Defense game where you also create own units to attack enemy towers so basically a combination of Tower Defense and Tower Offense. 

There is 6 different generals to choose (tho not on every possible level) affecting what one spell and what units you can use on selected mission.

There are 20 very unique levels (sometimes you only defend, sometimes only attack, sometimes do both, sometimes you have even different objective)
and quite a lot of different towers and traps to chose. 
Every few seconds you get money and food that you use to spend (money on towers/traps, food on units). On some levels you dont even get food or money due specific objective. 

Also you gather experience points at the end of every level (you can replay same level for easy exp farming if you want) to upgrade your skill tree and you can read ton of humerous text about hard life of goofy Evil Overlord. 
Story is kinda meh and cliche yet charming and funny.

Definitely recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198350107096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 1526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1070, 'last_played': 1663346503}
review: A los desarrolladores, les quiero felicitar por tan excelente trabajo! Horas de diversi√≥n garantizada. Un juego con un ambiente muy heavy metal, con escenarios que me recordaron al warcraft, con una mezcla de tower defense muy bien aplicada. Pagu√© 6 pesos mexicanos en una oferta! Estoy feliz de saber que cuando se tiene una brillante idea, y se ejecuta con eficacia, el juego excelente surge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057477918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1531668442}
review: From a dirt cheap game like this, I don't expect great graphics or original mechanics, but I do want a quick, somewhat novel tower defense experience. Not slow, unskippable tutorials filled with dialogue designed to entertain a toddler. Just let us get straight into the action with some interesting maps and minimize the forced humor and hand-holding, and we'll gladly pay four times this price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262626587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 373, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1645906731}
review:
What is Oh My Gore ?

Initially I was not going to recommend this game but considering how ridiculously cheap and simple it is, I dont think its bad for what offers neither for its price, its a very simple indie RTS game that pretty much plays itself, you barely have many input on it, all troops follow a preset path all you have to do is manage the defense buildings such as tower and such and the spawn rate of the troops while defending your "hero" but you have no control to the troops, hero or anything, its a simple game and considering that there are many other RTS games that do much and offer much more than this makes this game very passable but since you can get it for pretty much a single dollar or even less makes it not a bad pick at all its just a simple game to pass the time for people who are fine with RTS games but for people who arent really into  those type of games it would be better to just skip this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098400194', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 463, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1530966505}
review:
Muy buen juego.
Mezcla de Tower Defense, con RTS. Por una parte, tienes las torres, para defenderte de las oleadas de enemigos, y por otra, puedes enviar tu oleadas de tropas para destruir las bases enemigas. Adem√°s, puedes colocar trampas para da√±ar a los enemigos que pasen por alli.
Hay moderada cantidad de tropas y torres (aunque algunas son mucho m√°s √∫tiles que otras), los mapas est√°n buen dise√±ados, y la dificultad muy bien ajustada.
Lastima la IA, tanto del enemigo como de tus tropas, que es muy mala.
La historia tiene un buen sentido del humor, y entretiene.
Es un juego sorprendentemente bueno por su precio (est√° rebajado a menudo a 0.49‚Ç¨).

author: {'steamid': '76561198263427469', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 246, 'playtime_forever': 916, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 916, 'last_played': 1527700663}
review:
An unusual TD game.

I didn't want to buy this game for a long time. And I bought it last week. I can't say I was excited, but I found some cool features there.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1398189289
First of all, I liked the setting of being a bad guy. Skeletons, Orcs, Mummies, Harpies and etc.
You are bad guy who fights with good guys. There is a lot of humor and sarcasm in the story. Yeah, there is a story.

What about gameplay. Most of the missions are Attack&Defense. And it's fresh. You have one road where enemies attack you and you need to build towers. There is another, you attack. So, there are 2 resources, food for sending units and gold for building towers. There are also Pure TD missions, enemies come from all sides and you just defend.

There are 6 heroes. They stand at the end of the road and fight with leaked enemies. Each has unique attack unit and a spell. Also they are all affected in the story.

There is a very humble skill tree. Just 12 upgrades with 1-4 levels. (+5% damage, health and etc).

The main flaw of this game is shit graphics. The design is good, but graphics. I can't see it, it makes me suffer. Different resolutions, amount of frames and etc.... arghhh.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1398189266

Pros
- Attack&Defense TD game. Attacking is interesting.
- Six different commanders with special bonuses
- There is a story with nice texts

Cons
- Awful graphics with a good design
- Big numbers for everything. Hard to calculate in mind
- 1 unit can destroy all your defenses

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1398189496

[h1]Resume[/h1]
I have mixed feelings. There are good gameplay features and bad graphics. So, if you can survive this art, i think you will like this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008282906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 285, 'playtime_forever': 907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1532031351}
review:
Check out my Steam Curator page, "Minorthreatt Gaming Reviews." I have the most organized and extensive genre lists on Steam! Be sure to "FOLLOW" for more of my recommendations: http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31339849-Minorthreatt-Gaming-Reviews/?appid=257170

The Short of it: Bizarre tower defense game that puts you on defense and attack, and sports a comedic story with an actual plotline! (rare for a TD). Pixilated graphics remind me of mid-ninties nostalgia. Well-priced!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993619183', 'num_games_owned': 2616, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 590, 'last_played': 1525477435}
review:
Don't let the name scare you off.  Yes, body parts do fly off but they are very small.

Wait, let me try again.


Don't let the name scare you off.  Yes, you are an evil being doing evil things.

Wait, one last try.

Yes, it is a tower defense game.  No, it is not the most polished, and at times, the AI (yours and theirs) can be really dumb.  But if you are into TD games, and want to see something different, I think this one is worth a try.  I enjoyed it enough to finish on Normal, but not enough to go back and get those last achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068206728', 'num_games_owned': 709, 'num_reviews': 241, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1524183554}
review:
I have never changed my opinion of a game so drastically as with this one. At first I really enjoyed it, loved it to a certain extent, but in the ende I'm pissed. The game does the cheapest form of difficulty, Unit spam and gradually harder units, even though you can't do shit against them. "Just use a Firetower. Minotaurs have +50 to +100 fire damage" -> unlocks fire tower 6 matches after it was needed. Shit like this. Minions who just straight up cut the line, walk through your towers and shortcut to your boss, or just smash everything paired with the most useless ground traps I have ever seen in a Tower Defense game. 

But the worst insult of all. Was this one level. Where you unlock the Pharao. I AM STILL NOT OVER THAT ONE.
Nothing to defend, barely any waves, just you and a maze and silence. You try to find a correct path twice, through trial and error and waste over thirteen minutes on double speed on this. JUST YOUR UNITS DYING BECAUSE OF A DEAD END AND THEN CHANGING THE DIRECTION: THE LEVEL. I am seriously pissed about this one, all up on this point were to a certain extent cheap or way too easy, but this one takes the flippin piss. If you want to feel the pure excitement of this level, I posted a 2 minute clip on plays tv where my mate decided to read Urban Dictionary slash fiction to me, just so I don't get bored as much. 

Link will be here: https://plays.tv/video/5ad9327ee448279d63/rges?from=user&_t=eyJ0eXBlIjoiZnJvbSIsImxvY2F0aW9uIjoiUmVwbGF5VXNlckNvbnRyb2xsZXIuVXNlclZpZGVvc01vZC12aWRlb3MiLCJmZWVkX2lkIjoiNWFkOTMyN2VlNDQ4Mjc5ZDYzIiwiZ2FtZV9pZCI6IiIsImxpbmtfaWQiOiJ2aWRlb19saXN0X3RodW1iIn0%3D

I do NOT recommend this game, not even for 50 cents.

author: {'steamid': '76561198330888468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 507, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 617, 'last_played': 1520422020}
review:
This is a fun game, with simple graphics, a humorous story and surprisingly complex game play. (For example it has a simple but much approved of ability to select what targets the towers shoot at first.) Calling this a tower defense game, while true, doesn't really cover the entire story.
Heads up though, it's been out awhile, it seems like the promised level editor is probably not coming, and the English dialogue and explainations often make no sense or are incorrect. (I swear I would do a complete edit for free if I thought the developers were still around.)
The story is cute though, I find the characters interesting and the dialogue quite funny. The controls are (mostly) solid, and the music fun without getting annoying.
The only real dissapointment is that I had hoped for more functionailty at the keep, it would have been nice to spend 'blood' on improving tower and/or units, etc. 
Not a must buy for tower defense fans like myself, but quite fun for as long as the game lasts...

author: {'steamid': '76561198434116246', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1641061311}
review:
[h1]Review zu Oh My Gore![/h1]

PRO: 
- eine Vielzahl an detaillreich gestalteter Level
- eine Menge individueller Charaktere und Gegnertypen
- ansprechende Pixel-Art Grafik
- Spielprinzip ist einfach zu erlernen aber dennoch anspruchsvoll
- verschiedene Schwierigkeitsstufen
- humorvolle, deutsche Sprachausgabe
- stimmungsvoller Soundtrack
- Spielspa√ü f√ºr Zwischendurch

CON:
- nicht jedem gef√§llt Pixel-Art Grafik
- Sprachdialoge teilweise zu lang, aber keinesfalls langweilig

FAZIT:
Ein preisg√ºnstiges, nettes Tower-Defense Game mit einer Vielzahl liebevoll gestalteter Level und Charaktere und humorvoller Sprachausgabe f√ºr Zwischendurch. Nur zu empfehlen, sowohl f√ºr Gelegenheitsspieler als auch f√ºr Profi-Gamer!

SCORE:
4/5

author: {'steamid': '76561197996113496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1655, 'last_played': 1517647722}
review:
"Oh My Gore" ist [b]eine kleine Perle[/b], deren Gameplay im Kern auf dem WC3-Stronghold Prinzip aufbaut. Das bedeutet, dass ich √ºber eine leicht verteidigte Festung verf√ºge, die Gegner auf einem vorgegeben Pfad versuchen zu √ºberrennen. Das kann ich mit dem Errichten von T√ºrmen verhindern ("Tower-Defense"). Auf einem anderen Pfad oder - je nach Level - auch auf dem gleichen Pfad muss ich aber auch selbst Einheiten aussenden, die versuchen, die feindliche Festung zu zerst√∂ren. Direkte Kontrolle habe ich dabei nicht. [b]Stronghold-Prinzip[/b] eben.

Dieses Basiskonzept wird von "Oh my Gore" mit einigen Features wie [b]Wegfindung, Ressourcenmanagement und Einheitenauswahl[/b] aufgewertet. Angenehm auff√§llig ist auch das Leveldesign, dass sich √ºberwiegend durch Geschick und Abwechslungsreichtum auszeichnet. Einzelne Spielabschnitte sind aber auch missgl√ºckt und geradezu langweilig, im Gesamten bin ich aber begeistert. Erb√§rmlich schlecht ist lediglich die Wegfindung eigener oder fremder Einheiten. Nach jedem Kampf laufen diese zu einem vorgegeben Wegpunkt zur√ºck - lassen sich dabei beschie√üen und ggf. angreifen - um dann quasi neu loszulaufen. Gerade in der letzten Mission - wo man Einheiten aus dem Weg r√§umt - ist das frustrierend, weil wieder neue Einheiten nachgekommen sind. 

Die Schwierigkeit ist teilweise eher gering. Selbst im "Hard"-Modus lassen sich die meisten Level [b]ohne gro√üe Anstrengung[/b] meistern. Zu den wenigen Ausnahmen geh√∂rt insbesondere das letzte Level, dass insoweit kaum h√§ndelbar ist, wenn man den Sieg nicht fr√ºhzeitig herbeif√ºhrt. 

Einige [b]negative Elemente[/b] sind auch feststellbar. So habe ich zwar eine begrenzte Auswahl an T√ºrmen, mit fortschreitendem Spiel habe mich aber ertappt, dass ich doch nur einen einzigen Turm pr√§feriere und diesen vereinzelt mit anderen T√ºrmen kombiniere. Das ist durchaus schade, hier h√§tte ich mir vielleicht ein Stein-Schere-Papier Prinzip gew√ºnscht, einfach um mehr Vielfalt zu haben. Auch gen√ºgen meist drei oder vier zentral platzierte T√ºrme, um alle Gegnermassen auszuschalten. Ich komme also nicht in den Genuss, Wege mit T√ºrmen zuzupflastern. Auch ist es fast immer sinnvoller, T√ºrme aufzuwerten, als neue zu bauen. Auch hier w√§re Luft nach oben gewesen.

Eine gewisse Sympathie streicht dar√ºberhinaus die [b]gelungene Story[/b] und die Musik- und Sprachausgabe aus. Vereinfacht ausgedr√ºckt begleitet man einen Kriegsgott, der durch verheerte L√§ndereien zieht und dabei nach Rache d√ºrstet. Nach und nach schlie√üen sich diesen mehrere Antihelden an. Allein der H√∂hepunkt der Geschichte ist etwas entt√§uschend. Bis dahin ist die Story zwar nicht sonderlich gerissen, aber wegen der [b]witzigen Protagonisten[/b] durchaus angenehm anzuschauen. Die Musikausgabe ist unteres Mittelma√ü und im ersten Moment h√§lt man auch die Sprachausgabe f√ºr bestenfalls l√§cherlich. Hat man sich an die √ºberzeichneten Stimmen gew√∂hnt (positive Ausnahme: Hauptcharakter Raelius) macht es aber auch hier Spa√ü zu folgen.

Grafisch haben wir Pixelchen. Funzt mit dem Gameplay. 

Im Gesamten kann ich es gerne weiterempfehlen, es ist den geringen Vollpreis komplett wert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005087106', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1515106636}
review:
Game still suffers from glitchy path finding and some levels are almost broken to the point i was about to unnistall the game, yet somehow i managed to get past them, eventually. Other that these obvious problems, i gotta say, the game pretty enjoyable, incorporating most of the things you probably love about TD's. You place towers, you summon armies and send them to your enemies (here where the glitchy pathing comes), and you somewhat control your hero (not actually, just cast spells on the map). 

TL:DR
Not great, but good with some flaws and 2 almost unbeatable levels (at least for me)

author: {'steamid': '76561198065457409', 'num_games_owned': 2925, 'num_reviews': 593, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1523286084}
review:
WORTH BUYING!

This game is a gem under the trash, unexpected. This game is a tower defense, which is ... yeah tower defense.Simple tower defense, same rock-paper-scissor dynamics, with the same old part. The realy special is that Deadalic shared there voice actors with the developers. And with that the nearly plain story gots a very nice touch. The story is told very good with this and the characters realy creates athmospere. The jokes are lame as in the rest of the deadalic games, but for that price OK.

author: {'steamid': '76561198798133967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1514073898}
review:
Great tower defense game ! You not only need to defend your base against the enemies but also to send them your monsters to destroy their own ! It is monsters because in this game you are some kind of resurrected skeleton lord willing to conquer the lands around him. Funny story and there are laughable dialogues which make the game comic in the good way.

However the graphics are pretty meh, I wish some more works were done on them and maybe it would have be better to have soft vector graphics instead of bitmaps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202265970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1509712763}
review:
un Ottimo titolo nei quali vestiremo i panni di un signore del Male che dovr√† servirsi di temibili e mostruosi comandanti.

per distruggere le forze del bene.

il gioco e un ibrido strategico/tower defense  efficace in certi versi un p√≤ meno in altri.

sul lato strategico poco da dire non complesso come titoli quali Age of Empire o Stronghold. ma funzionale ed immediato anche per chi non mastica molto bene il genere. 

sulla sponda tower defense esso fa un figurone 
rendendosi giocabilissimo e godibile al massimo se amate i tower defense quelli per dispositivi mobile, potete anche procedere al acquisto e smettere di leggere il resto se invece siete ancora scettici leggete qualche altra riga per poi valutarne il valore.



il gioco come dicevo mischia perfettamente il genere tower denfese fondendosi in parte con lo  strategico regalando limitazioni al giocatore in fasi di attacco con tracciati da seguire per le nostre truppe limitati da si va a destra o a sinistra! con l'ausilio di delle truppe quali portabandiera potremo scegliere il nostro percorso di marcia..lontano anni luce da uno strategico vero e proprio dove abbiamo libert√† di movimento e di azione..ma a discapito di cio e proprio l'azione quella che non manchera a questo gioco, a discapito dei vari ragionamenti che si fanno negli strategici classici qui ci sar√† meno tempo per pensare e piu per agire. infatti disponendo di una fabrica dei mostri altro non dovremo fare che mandare le nostre truppe allo sbaraglio per conquistare il vilaggio di passaggio lungo la strada bisogner√† distruggere ed impadronirsi degli avamposti nemici per poter produrre mostri che partiranno da quelle posizioni.

oltre a questo il nostro compito sar√† quello di difendere il nostro Generale dalle incursioni nemiche Generale che molto piu forte di un unit√† semplice ma che non avr√† possibilita di movimento ma solamente di attacco per difenderlo oltre a creare unit√† di creature quali orchi, diavoli e scheletri, minotauri chi ne ha pi√π ne metta! bisogner√† difenderlo con l'ausilio di torrette/ avamposti, trappole di vario tipo e mitragliarici piazziabili lungo la mappa di gioco. ognuno di questi sistemi di difesa sar√† potenziabile fino ad un certo livello verrano spesi dei soldi per permettere al giocatore di potenziare gli attrezzi  mentre con un sistema di cibo si potranno creare le unit√†, ovviamente ogni sistema di difesa verr√† preso di mira dal nemico che prover√† a distruggerlo piu velocemente possibile. al termine di ogni missione si sbloccheranno nuove mosse e contenuti.. inoltre ci verr√† messo di fronte un sistema di potenziamenti con abilit√† passive che andranno a potenziare e facilitare le nostre partite. potranno essere sbloccati nuovi generali giocabili ognuno con una propria abilit√† speciale e nuove unit√† da evocare in gioco. il gioco e fatto in pixel art ed e animato davvero bene. il tutto condito da una veste ironica che rende il titolo scorrevole e piacevole allo stesso modo,
non posso nascondere che il gioco dai il meglio di se nelle missioni defense ovvero quelle in cui bisogna difendersi esclusivamente dagli attacchi nemici diventando cosi un tower defense assoluto.

un idea tutto sommata buona, unita ad un genere ibrido che nonostante qualche carenza e ben congeniato rendendosi accessibile a una larga utenza mixato tutto con un ottima dose di ironia lo rendono un gioco assolutamente valido

poi se siete amanti del macabro o dei tower defense questo gioco fa assolutamente al caso vostro.

consiglio tutta via di prenderlo in sconto visto che il prezzo cala moltissimo e vale ancora di pi√π l'acquisto 

7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198050379221', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1512336675}
review:
I <3 tower defense. This game seemed promising at first with both attackers and towers, but by the 8th level it became a complete tedious chore.  

Even though it has mainly positive reviews, the negative reviews pointing out the poor execution and artificially difficult enemy attacks (non-stop, stronger over time vs easily destroyed towers) make this a hassle I won't even complete. 

I also won't hold my breath for the developers to fix the balancing issues. There was clearly a good amount of thought and work put into the game, but it's like they quit the 25th mile into the marathon. 

Delete.

author: {'steamid': '76561198384659626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1631959376}
review:
Do yourself a favor and do not take this game seriously. 
This is not a game for people that care. 
This is a game for people that like to walk the maddening path of war with all consequences. 
This is a game for people that like sacrificing masses of loyal minions for just the giggles.
Whilst this ist what makes you started, you end up playing a solid tower defense game and aim for a 100% in highest difficulty.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991149889', 'num_games_owned': 367, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 848, 'last_played': 1510412957}
review:
EDITED (level editor achievement was removed, which is good because now you can get all the achievements)

Overall unbalanced game. I finished the whole game on hard using only gargoyle+magic towers and spamming minotaurs, except for last level. Other towers have way too short range and can't kill agressive units in time. Story was okay and humour was good, gameplay seemed promising in the first hours but disappointed later on. With a balancing update this game could get a lot better. Since they removed the level editor achievement, I'm split between yes and no. Yes because this game has potential, the gameplay was interesting, tower defense AND tower offense. Also I loved the dialogues. No because, like I said, some towers seem unbalanced. So I would say this is worth in a sale

author: {'steamid': '76561198000109431', 'num_games_owned': 1315, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 726, 'last_played': 1510133549}
review:
I snagged this game on sale for 49 cents. At first I thought I‚Äôd found a little rough gem, but upon completing the game I can safely say to anyone do not purchase this game! The hugest disclaimer you should know is that you cannot 100 percent this game because one achievement is tied to creating a map in an editor that does not exist and the developers have abandoned work on it.

Initially the game was fun, graphically it‚Äôs charming, the characters witty and you go about forming your marry band of misfits. Then you‚Äôll notice that the game relies heavily on the following to generate a huge sense of artificial difficulty.

-Limited Tower Range
-Spamming Enemies
-Traps that degrade rapidly (made worse by enemy spam)
-Tower destroyers that you will find difficult to counter because of their health and the limited range on your towers
-Limited tower placement area
-Enemies gain health the longer the match goes on, if you stalemate it‚Äôs a guaranteed loss. With the spam and other issues you‚Äôll stalemate a few times.

The bad balancing is easily overlookable with the exception of three levels, but the final level is outright abysmal in regards to the shortcomings of the game becoming a major hassle. Now the worst part is the game‚Äôs ending. This is your only spoiler warning and I‚Äôll keep it vague so you can experience it firsthand. 

It turns out you are being manipulated by the muse, to kill your friends who she wronged, kill the other gods of war, and then commit suicide in one of thee worst endings I‚Äôve ever had the displeasure of experiencing. You get not closure, no satisfaction; the real villain ends up getting away with everything. This is made all the more painful as the game has an arch where all your characters soften and become more peaceful while exploring what Raelius will do once there is no more war.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007216860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 765, 'last_played': 1510072979}
review:
*Update*  It looks like they finally fixed the achivments issue!! 
                A small plus for that.   

Gameplay 

Decent TD core machanics +

In later levels, specially on Hard you need no tactics.
You have to rush otherwise the enemy will swarm you with troops, 
which  get more health and power, the longer you take. 

Even the best paced TD will be overrun and if you take to long you have no chance of wining. 

Pathfinding sometimes screws you as well. If your units attack a tower they 
allways walk back a few tilles and make a surcle. And with enemy troops advanceing
you can get stuck in limbo.  

Also the enemy troops atacking towers don¬¥t follow the path and take shortcuts.

Same with your heroes. Some abilities are much more effective then others and specialy the 
charm is as usless as it gets.

The story is ok. Nothing new nothing old and some fun moments.

The achivments are also not 100% possible because of the missing editor. 

Overall a playable TF for fans. 
Get it when its on sale and you have some fun with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067888927', 'num_games_owned': 1632, 'num_reviews': 302, 'playtime_forever': 1043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 820, 'last_played': 1511631624}
review:
Having recently begun to play this game, the number one piece of advice I can give you is not to judge it too soon. When I first opened up this title I saw some rough edges and a few spelling errors here and there. Plus, it was so inexpensive that I was nervous about that feature as well. However...

As the game progresses you start to enjoy the characters a bit more and their conversations. The challenge does increase and the music...my god the music is brilliant. For the low price I paid, I seriously cannot complain.

That said, here are my only two complaints :) 

- There is a level editor achievement that is literally impossible to complete because the feature was never built
- The higher resolutions seem to just stretch the game, instead of increasing it's detail. The art would look much better if I could use a larger portion of my monitor.

Still, the title is worth it if you like sarcastic evil or small-scale TD games. Enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054387451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 290, 'playtime_forever': 819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1603108981}
review:
"Oh, my gore! A good game!"

A reversed tower-defense game, where YOU play the bad guy and destroy all the buildings!
With both tower- and unit management, good music and unique visuals with the homemade "gore" engine.

And I especially love the quirky humor/dialogues that are so typical for the Dev/publisher Daedalic Games.

A hidden gem and must have for anti-tower defense games and weird scenarios in a fantasy ambient√©.
